channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: US, EU, UK condemn Jolo blasts
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: The United States, the European Union and the United Kingdom yesterday condemned the bombings in Jolo, Sulu on Monday that claimed the lives of 14 soldiers and civilians.

item.title: Survivors recount Jolo carnage
item.author: Roel Pareño
item.description: Death and destruction came like a bolt of lightning to a group of soldiers after a suicide bombing attack the first of two on the same day by an Islamic militant at a marketplace in downtown Jolo before noon on Monday.

item.title: Duterte denies involvement in revolutionary government
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: President Duterte yesterday denied he had a hand in efforts by his supporters to mount a revolutionary government, saying he was not interested in instituting such changes.

item.title: Duterte now wants to be last to get COVID-19 vaccine
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Weeks after volunteering to be the first to try out Russia’s coronavirus vaccine, President Duterte now says he is willing to be the last to be inoculated to ensure that the poor will be prioritized.

item.title: Duterte to Robredo: Don’t add fuel to the fire
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: President Duterte has asked Vice President Leni Robredo “not to add fuel to the fire,” taking a swipe apparently at her criticism of the administration’s response to the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Lagman questions government funding for COVID-19 measures
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: Albay Rep. Edcel Lagman has questioned the “meager” P165-billion stimulus fund under the proposed Bayanihan to Recover as One Act or Bayanihan 2 Law that the President is expected to sign this week.

item.title: DBM submits proposed P4.5 trillion budget for 2021
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: Budget Secretary Wendell Avisado submitted to the House of Representatives yesterday the executive department’s proposed P4.5-trillion national budget for 2021, which has also earmarked funds for acquisition of vaccines for COVID-19.

item.title: Doc says Duterte illness nearing stage one cancer
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: More than a week after rumors circulated that he is sick, President Duterte disclosed yesterday that his doctor advised him to stop drinking as his Barrett’s esophagus is nearing stage one cancer.

item.title: Go Negosyo backs COVID-19 saliva test
item.description: Presidential Adviser for Entrepreneurship and Go Negosyo founder Joey Concepcion has received commitment of support from SeaOil Philippines president Glenn Yu for the implementation of Saliva COVID Test, aside from Pooled Swab Testing launched earlier this month as part of its testing innovations.

item.title: Army chief wants martial law in Sulu
item.author: Michael Punongbayan
item.description: Army chief Lt. Gen. Cirilito Sobejana wants the province of Sulu placed under martial law following Monday’s twin explosions in Jolo allegedly carried out by suicide bombers of the Abu Sayyaf group.
